text: nothing beats the taste texture and
color of homemade mayonnaise compared to
that store bought version however a lot
of recipes out there are tricky to make
and you end up with a broken mess I'm
going to show you today a foolproof
method that uses an immersion blender
and you'll be making homemade Mayo all
summer long I have two farm-fresh egg
yolks in the base of a 2 cup measure to
that I'm gonna add a hefty tablespoon of
Dijon mustard and Dijon mustard all of
the mustards actually are emulsifiers so
the more you use the thicker it will be
to this I'm going to add about a
teaspoon of lemon juice you could use
vinegar here as well and 1/4 teaspoon of
kosher salt just start mixing this
together with the blades of the
immersion blender and now for the oil
I'm using grapeseed oil any neutral
flavored oil start with a slow steady
stream and then you can add at a faster
rate now it's about 3/4 of a cup of oil
to a cup of oil and this would be a
great point to add some flavoring so if
you wanted to add some pesto if you
wanted some sriracha for some heat
anything you want to flavor this with
you can as you can see it's nice and
creamy the color is a wonderful pale
yellow and my favorite way to serve this
is just on a simple burger this would be
delicious with a crispy side of french
fries mix this into coleslaw's salad
dressings and now you're ready for
summer there you go
hey guys thanks for watching do you have
a kitchen conundrum that you need solved
well if you do write in the comment
section below and as always click
Subscribe
